page.title: 13Odells Leather Industry
page.content: There was an established{leather {dressing plant}on the River Ouse, in Odell, in the last century, and it was in 1919 that the then owner,{Philip {Westley, built his new factory}at a cost of 20,000 pounds sterling. Bankruptcy forced the sale of the factory which has since become the home of{Odell Leather Industries. Ready tanned hides are purchased from many parts of the world; in Odell they are 'dressed'-prepared for sale to the fashion industry. In the 1970's a new department was set up to use surplus materials for the manufacture of belts and handbags. 225 people are employed in the works in Odell, many of them transported to work in their fleet of mini-buses. The manager told us that it would be difficult to find enough employees without free transport.
